metadata.title: CVE-2018-5160 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
WebRTC can use a "WrappedI420Buffer" pixel buffer but the owning imageobject can be freed while it is still in use. This can result in the WebRTCencoder using uninitialized memory, leading to a potentially exploitablecrash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 60.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
